body: I think that I'm experiencing the same issue. I'm adding a field with a `"` character in its value and this `"` is not being escaped in logfmt output.

issue.title: Safely format data when printing
issue.body:
Fixes #531

I'm taking this over from @kpcyrd who started in https://github.com/sirupsen/logrus/pull/573 and will take care of the changes discussed in the initial PR:

> Either we should remove the `QuoteCharacter` option completely or make sure that it is used in a safe way.

I decided that removing the option is not a good solution because probably people depend on it. Therefore, we need to implement proper escaping.

body:
I've pinged @bbrks, who introduced the QuoteCharacter option in #484 to discuss removing it, as
that option is substentially increasing the complexity of the formatter.

Hi @kpcyrd,
You're right and I'm able to reproduce this: https://play.golang.org/p/JWfN3X7h3W

I'm not sure what `%q` does internally to be honest. The [docs](https://golang.org/pkg/fmt/) state that it returns "a double-quoted string safely escaped with Go syntax". Almost the same is done by `strconv.QuoteToASCII` which also applies quoting. 

With #575, my intention was to fix the quoting issue (quotes in strings not being escaped correctly). If we can find a way to escape strings exactly like `%q` without using `%q` (because of the `QuoteCharacter` feature), I'd be happy to integrate it!

issue.title: Remove QuoteCharacter option
issue.body:
This seems to be one of the most reported issues, as it makes it a lot rarder to safely escape strings.

This option is very much an edge case, and it's causing too much issues compared to what it provide.

Closes #531

cc @sirupsen @bbrks @seiffert @kpcyrd

body:
After I had some issues with an outdated `logrus.a` (I'm still not good with golang) I could verify the bugfix works for my logging-binary-data usecase :) Thanks!

One more thing that you might want to keep in mind is that the log message and keys is currently not safe. Those are theoretically less likely to contain non-hardcoded data tho:
```go
package main

import (
	"log"
	logrus "github.com/sirupsen/logrus"
)

func main() {
	stuff := "test\"\xff\xff\xff\xff\x30\x00\x00\x00\x00test\xee\x81\x9a"

	log.Printf("test: %q\n", stuff)

	logrus.WithFields(logrus.Fields{
		"animal": "walrus",
		"stu\xff": stuff,
	}).Info("A bug\nwas verified")
}
```

Output:
```
2017/07/17 06:04:21 test: "test\"\xff\xff\xff\xff0\x00\x00\x00\x00test\ue05a"
INFO[0000] A bug
was verified                            animal=walrus stu�="test\"\xff\xff\xff\xff0\x00\x00\x00\x00test\ue05a"
```

issue.title: Keys may need quoting
issue.body:
From @kpcyrd in #531.

The log message and keys is currently not safe. Those are theoretically less likely to contain non-hardcoded data tho:
```go
package main

import (
	"log"
	logrus "github.com/sirupsen/logrus"
)

func main() {
	stuff := "test\"\xff\xff\xff\xff\x30\x00\x00\x00\x00test\xee\x81\x9a"

	log.Printf("test: %q\n", stuff)

	logrus.WithFields(logrus.Fields{
		"animal": "walrus",
		"stu\xff": stuff,
	}).Info("A bug\nwas verified")
}
```

Output:
```
2017/07/17 06:04:21 test: "test\"\xff\xff\xff\xff0\x00\x00\x00\x00test\ue05a"
INFO[0000] A bug
was verified                            animal=walrus stu�="test\"\xff\xff\xff\xff0\x00\x00\x00\x00test\ue05a"
```

body: Thank you @kpcyrd. I've opened another issue with this problem, and will be looking into it soon.
